title: Europe from May to December,
author: Williams, Rudolph.
snippet: The city of Geneva supplied him with munitions of war, for which Bonnivard parted with his birthright. The revenues of the birthright were used to support the City Hospital. He was afterward employed in the service of the Republic, but in 1530, when traveling between Moudon and Lausanne, he fell into the liands of his old enemy, the Duke of Savoy, who imprisoned him in the Castle of Chillon.
